title: Hilton Hotels launches Kids Stay free deal for October half term
text:

Hilton Hotels is giving families the chance to bag some cheap last-minute breaks for half term with its latest deal.

The hotel chain has unveiled a new Kids Stay Free, Eat Free package, where kids aged up to 12 years old can stay for free when sharing a room with a paying adult.

Meanwhile, kids aged up to five years old can eat for free during the same travel period, with complimentary lunch and dinner in one of the hotel's restaurants.

The best part is that the package is currently on offer across a number of Hilton hotels in both the UK and abroad including Europe, the Middle East and Africa.

You can book the deal on the Hilton Hotels website already , for stays between Friday 25th October through to Monday 4th November.

The offer is also available to book on the Hilton Honors App, which you can download from both the Apple Store or Google Play.

(Image: REX/Shutterstock)

There are heaps of different brands under the Hilton portfolio taking part including Hampton Inn & Suites , DoubleTree by Hilton , Hilton Garden Inn and Hilton Hotels & Resorts .

There are also luxury brands including Conrad Hotels & Resorts , Curio - A Collection by Hilton , LXR Hotels & Resorts and Waldorf Astoria Hotels & Resorts .

You can find out more and see the full list of brands in the deal's terms and conditions online .

Hilton isn't the only hotel brand offering up deals for families this half term.

Premier Inn currently has a sale with rooms from £29.50pp , while Travelodge has heaps of deals and discounts including free meals for kids when they're with paying adults.

As for keeping the kids entertained on a budget? We've got you covered, as we've searched out the best cheap days out for half term across the UK, including plenty of fun and spooky events for Halloween too!

Oh, and you may also want to check out our guide to the best free activities in the UK as well as fun things to do with the kids on rainy days .
description: Hilton Hotels has launched an October half term deal where kids can stay and eat for free
